description.narrative: The project promotes peace through the creation of sustainable safe dialogue spaces for communities to discuss climate-related issues and collectively identify adaptation solutions.

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1.1.1: Number (#) of gender-sensitive dialogues and deliberations on climate-security issues 1.1.2: Number (#) of women and men with enhanced understanding and skills on civic engagement and climate security 1.1.3: Number (#) of traditional, religious and local authorities sensitized on women’s participation in decision making spaces 1.1.4: Number (#) of CSOs contracted to conduct community sensitization and awareness building 1.2.1: Number (#) of dialogue fora created between local authorities and community members 1.2.2: Number (#) of gender-sensitive decisions taken through dialogue fora and implemented 1.2.3: Number (#) of community-based monitoring structures created 1.3.1: Number (#) of community radios and right holders with enhanced capacities and knowledge on climate security risks and to claim their rights vis à vis authorities 1.3.2: Number (#) of CSOs contracted to conduct community sensitization and awareness building 1.3.3: Number (#) of community radios campaigns on civic engagement and climate security 2.1.1. Number of women, men, boys and girls receiving food/cash-based transfers/commodity vouchers/capacity strengthening transfers; 2.1.2 Total value of food/cash-based transfers/commodity vouchers transferred to targeted beneficiaries; 2.1.3. Number of hectares rehabilitated in the targeted areas. 2.1.4 Percentage of farmers reporting increased agricultural productivity in targeted communities disaggregated by sex 2.1.5: Proportion of population (%) with improved ability to manage and maintain household and community livelihood assets due to an enhanced livelihood asset base disaggregated by sex 2.2.1 Number of men and [AV4] women supported through training 2.2.2 Number of trainings and capacity strengthening activities organised 2.2.3 4 Percentage of farmers reporting improved knowledge of climate-resilient practices disaggregated by sex

comment.narrative: Output Indicator 1.1.1: 18 Output Indicator 1.1.2: TBD Output Indicator 1.1.3: TBD Output Indicator 1.1.4: At least 4 Output Indicator 1.2.1: 3 Output Indicator 1.2.2: TBD Output Indicator 1.2.3: 3 Output Indicator 1.3.1: 10 Output Indicator 1.3.2: 4 Output Indicator 1.3.3: 4 Output Indicator 2.1.1: 5250 beneficiaries Output Indicator 2.1.2: USD 105.000 Output Indicator 2.1.3: TBD Output Indicator 2.1.4: 90% Output Indicator 2.1.5: 60% Output Indicator 2.2.1: 375 women and men Output Indicator 2.2.2: 21 trainings (7 trainings per sector) Output Indicator 2.2.3: 50%

Output 1.1 Effective mechanisms to gather affected communities for participation, free expression, and deliberation on climate-security issues are created and enhanced Output 1.2. Dialogue fora for citizens to voice their concerns and design their own solutions that can inform national/local governments’ strategies and interventions are facilitated Output 1.3 The capacities and knowledge of right holders and media are enhanced to analyze the impact of climate change, understand existing laws and regulations, and explore possible adaptation measures. Output 2.1 Vulnerable communities, especially women, are supported through income-generating resilience activities, including rehabilitation of land, construction of dykes and wells and distribution of inputs and tools. Output 2.2 Rural women are empowered to actively engage and lead in the community-level decision-making process on climate change adaptation through trainings on basic business skills and climate-resilient agricultural practices and techniques
